title.rendered: Desert vs Gulf, International League, 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Desert: Rohan Mustafa, Alex Hales, Colin Munro (c), Sam Billings (wk), Sherfane Rutherford, Wanindu Hasaranga, Tom Curran, Gus Atkinson, Luke Wood, Sheldon Cottrell, Shiraz Ahmed

Gulf: James Vince (c), Chris Lynn, Tom Banton (wk), Shimron Hetmyer, Aayan Afzal Khan, David Wiese, Gerhard Erasmus, Rehan Ahmed, Chris Jordan, Dominic Drakes, Sanchit Sharma

Venue: Dubai International Stadium, Dubai

Pitch Report

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 160

2nd innings average score: 158

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 67%

Batting 2nd: 33%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Sherfane Rutherford has enjoyed batting at Dubai. He has collected 111 runs at 56 including the highest score of 50.

Chris Jordan is the only bowler to take 4 three-fors in this edition, owing to which he is the leading wicket-taker (13).

Wanindu Hasaranga is yet to go wicketless in Dubai this season. In 4 games, he has bagged 6 wickets, including the best figures of 3 for 18.

When these teams met earlier in the tournament, Alex Hales (99 off 57) and Shimron Hetmyer (70 off 35 and a catch) were the captain and vice-captain of the Ultimate Team respectively.

It has been a hat-trick of appearances in the Ultimate Team for Chris Lynn. He also smashed 71 off 42 in his last game at Dubai.

An average of 7 sixes per innings has been launched at the venue in the last 3 games.

In the same period, 2 of 3 three-wicket hauls have gone the way of the seamers.

The spinners have tasted reasonable success in Dubai. 33% of the wickets in the last 3 matches belong to them.
